title: HUNTR/X’s ‘Golden,’ From ‘KPop Demon Hunters,’ Conquers Billboard Global Charts for 10th Week
summary: Plus, Olivia Dean’s “Man I Need” reaches the charts’ top 10.
body: HUNTR/X ’s “Golden,” from Netflix’s animated smash movie KPop Demon Hunters , dominates the Billboard Global 200 and Billboard Global Excl. U.S. charts for a 10th week each. In July, the song became the first No. 1 on each list for the act, whose music is voiced by EJAE, Audrey Nuna and REI AMI. Related HUNTR/X’s ‘Golden’ Tops Hot 100 for Sixth Week, the Most for a Soundtrack Hit in 10 Years HUNTR/X Singers Talk Destiny’s Child Parallels & Possible ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Sequel Twenty One Pilots’ ‘Breach’ Bows Atop Billboard 200 With Biggest Week for a Rock Album in Six Years “Golden” is just the eighth of 72 No. 1s since the Global 200 began in September 2020 to rule for double-digit weeks. On Global Excl. U.S., it’s only the sixth of 63 leaders to reach the milestone. Hits from KPop Demon Hunters account for half the Global 200’s top 10 for a fifth week. Below “Golden,” Saja Boys hold at No. 3 with “Soda Pop” and No. 4 with “Your Idol,” with both having reached No. 3; both are sung by Andrew Choi, Neckwav, Danny Chung, Kevin Woo and samUIL Lee. Plus, HUNTR/X’s “How It’s Done” drops a spot from its No. 5 high and “W…
